snippet: The older or disabled residents said in a lawsuit that they were unfairly removed from the program after their spouses or parents died.
abstract: New York City agrees to pay $130,000 in legal fees and damages to 10 older or disabled residents who claim they were unfairly removed from Rent Freeze Program after deaths of spouses or parents; suit filed by public advocate Letitia James is intended to highlight flaws in legislation, which was drafted to help more people qualify for rent freeze.
lead_paragraph: The older or disabled residents said in a lawsuit that they were unfairly removed from the program after their spouses or parents died.

headline.main: New York to Pay Thousands to 10 Tenants Purged From Rent Freeze Program
headline.print_headline: City to Pay $130,000 in Rent-Freeze Suit
